segments.title: Definition of Density
segments.summary: Density is explained as the ratio of mass to volume, measuring how packed something is. Examples given include water (1 g/cm³) and iron (7.8 g/cm³) to illustrate different densities.

segments.title: Density and Floating Objects
segments.summary: Explains how objects with lower density float while those with higher density sink. Examples include oil floating on water and iron sinking in water.

segments.title: Water Density Temperature Relationship
segments.summary: Details how water's density changes with temperature, reaching maximum density at 4°C. This unique property affects how water bodies behave in cold conditions.

segments.title: Air Density Variation
segments.summary: Explains how air density varies with altitude, being about 0.1 g/cm³ at surface level and decreasing to 0.004 g/cm³ at typical airline cruising altitude.

segments.title: Earth Formation and Density
segments.summary: Describes how Earth's structure formed based on density differences, with heavier metals sinking to the core and lighter silicates floating to form the crust.
